required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Placebo-controlled, Dose-escalation Study of the Safety of IMO-2125 (Immunomodulatory Oligonucleotide) in Hepatitis C-infected Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Multi-center, Placebo-controlled, Dose-escalation Study of the Safety of IMO-2125 in Hepatitis C-infected Patients Unresponsive to Standard Treatment With Pegylated Interferon and Ribavirin

brief_summary.textblock: First-in-humans, phase 1, dose-escalation study with 4 dose levels of single-agent IMO-2125.

detailed_description.textblock: First-in-humans, phase 1, dose-escalation study with 4 dose levels of single-agent IMO-2125. Patients will proceed through a screening period, treatment period, and follow-up period of approximately 4 months' duration. There will be 4 dose cohorts including active drug and placebo dosing.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: From screening through study completion, 86 to 115 days in total
primary_outcome.description: Count and percentage of subjects with treatment emergent adverse events

arm_group.description: IMO-2125 given twice a week at 0.16 mg/kg

intervention.description: IMO-2125 is a synthetic DNA-based agonist of Toll-like receptor 9 (TLR9), TLR9 is expressed in humans in plasmacytoid dendritic cells and B cells of the immune system

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- HCV-positive
- Nonresponder to standard-dose pegylated interferon-α-2a or -α-2b in combination with standard-dose ribavirin
Exclusion Criteria:
- Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)or hepatitis B surface antigen (HbsAg)
- Inadequate bone marrow, liver, and renal function
- Treatment with any IFN (interferon)-based or other experimental or antiviral therapies within 30 days
- Other significant medical diseases
- Known alcohol or drug abuse within the past 12 months

clinical_study.keyword: unresponsive to pegylated interferon and ribavirin therapy

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study enrolled patients with chronic infection with hepatitis C virus (HCV) who were “null responders” to prior treatment with pegylated-interferon-alfa (peg-IFN-α) plus ribavirin. The study included patients with any HCV genotype.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All enrolled subjects who qualified after the pre-screening period were assigned to a treatment group and treated.

group.description: Weekly saline placebo Saline placebo: saline placebo given subcutaneously

class.title: TEAE leading to study drug discontinuation
Related TEAE causing study drug discontinuation

reported_events.time_frame: From screening through study completion, 86 to 115 days in total
reported_events.desc: Any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation patient administered a pharmaceutical product; it does not necessarily have to have a causal relationship with this treatment. An Adverse Event can, therefore, be any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding, for example), symptom, or disease temporarily associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered to be related to the medicinal product.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There IS an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
